intro: Anacampta rigida, commonly known as the rigid anacampta, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright, rigid stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense cluster, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens.
